g.text: Do Not Cite, Quote or Distribute

interact with global drivers like climate change and lead to tipping points

ble challenge to implementation of nature

Biodiversity may improve resilience to climate
diverse systems could be more resilient to climate change impacts, thereby
maintaining ecosystem function and preserving biodiversity
ecosystem functions due species shifts or reductions in diversity may impair the positive effects of

eractions can augment the effectiveness of forests in reducing climate change impacts on
). In spite of the many synergies between climate policy
instruments and biodiversity conservation, however, current policies oft
en fall short of realising this
Development of satellite technologies to assess potential
deforestation has grown in recent years with the release of 30 m data by
this data only captures tree cover loss, and increasing accuracy over time may limit its use for trend
. Datasets on forest losses are less well developed
point out, there has been significant
improvement in the ability to measure changes in tree and carbon density on sites using satellite data,
but these techniques are still evolving and improving and they are not yet availab
based forest inventory measurements have been developed in many countries, most
prominently in the northern hemisphere, but more and more countries are starting to develop and collect
capacity building is going on in many developing countries
under UNREDD and FAO programmes. Additional efforts to harmonize data collection methods and
to make forest inventory data available to the scientific community would improve confidence in forest
tatistics, and changes in forest statistics over time. To some extent the Global Forest Biodiversity
Initiative fills in this data gap (
Linkages to ecosystem services, human well
The linkage between biodiversity, ecosystem services, human well
biodiversity and ecosystem services will have an adverse impact on quality of life, human well
Such losses will not only affect current economic
growth but also impede the capacity for future economic growth.
Population growth, economic development, urbanisation, technology, climate change
consumption, policy and governance are key drivers of global environmental change over recent
